course_title: History and Practice of Christian-Muslim Relations
class_notes: (Same as HC 651 500) (ON CAMPUS) (Meets weekdays 10:00am-3:30pm) (some class sessions will include off-campus field trips to visit mosques and interfaith community organizations in the Atlanta area)
course_description: This course introduces students to the history of Christian-Muslim relations from early Islamic period to present and acquaints them with recent initiatives for interfaith dialogue. Attention is given to multiple global contexts and to the culture and theological diversity of both Islam and Christianity.
schedule_location: MTWThF 10am-3:30pm in Rita Anne Rollins Building_102
sections: Class Nbr: 2050, Section #: 500, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MTWThF 10a-3:30p, Instructor: D. Womack, Status: Open
